item.title: $1.8bn Five Dock Development Takes Shape
item.description:
Source: Real Commercial

Metrics has partnered with Deicorp for a $1.8 billion project in Sydney's Five Dock, aiming to create a vibrant village precinct. This development will contribute nearly 25% towards the local council's goal of 5,000 new homes by 2029.

Read full article →
item.content:encoded:
Source: Real Commercial

Metrics has partnered with Deicorp for a $1.8 billion project in Sydney's Five Dock, aiming to create a vibrant village precinct. This development will contribute nearly 25% towards the local council's goal of 5,000 new homes by 2029.

Read full article →

item.title: Refinancing Surge Shakes Up Banking Sector
item.description:
Source: realestate.com.au News

A major bank has implemented more rate cuts this year than in the last decade, responding to a wave of savvy borrowers seeking better deals. This refinancing rush is putting pressure on banks to remain competitive in the current market.

Read full article →
item.content:encoded:
Source: realestate.com.au News

A major bank has implemented more rate cuts this year than in the last decade, responding to a wave of savvy borrowers seeking better deals. This refinancing rush is putting pressure on banks to remain competitive in the current market.

Read full article →

item.title: Queen Victoria Market to deliver thousands of homes
item.description:
Source: realestate.com.au News

The revamp of Melbourne's Queen Victoria Market will introduce a new precinct featuring build-to-rent, student accommodation, and affordable housing. This development aims to significantly increase housing supply in the inner city.

Read full article →
item.content:encoded:
Source: realestate.com.au News

The revamp of Melbourne's Queen Victoria Market will introduce a new precinct featuring build-to-rent, student accommodation, and affordable housing. This development aims to significantly increase housing supply in the inner city.

Read full article →

item.title: HomeCo's $56.5M Retail Asset Deal
item.description:
Source: RE Source

HMC Capital has contracted to buy and sell east coast retail investments for the HomeCo Daily Needs REIT, with Warilla Grove fetching $56.5 million. This move highlights ongoing activity in the retail sector as the group continues to expand its portfolio.

Read full article →
item.content:encoded:
Source: RE Source

HMC Capital has contracted to buy and sell east coast retail investments for the HomeCo Daily Needs REIT, with Warilla Grove fetching $56.5 million. This move highlights ongoing activity in the retail sector as the group continues to expand its portfolio.

Read full article →

item.title: Mirvac sees recovery despite 16% earnings drop
item.description:
Source: AFR - Commercial Property

Mirvac reports a 16% fall in residential earnings but anticipates improvement as housing conditions begin to recover. As one of the first major listed developers to release full-year results, their outlook suggests a positive shift in the market.

Read full article →
item.content:encoded:
Source: AFR - Commercial Property

Mirvac reports a 16% fall in residential earnings but anticipates improvement as housing conditions begin to recover. As one of the first major listed developers to release full-year results, their outlook suggests a positive shift in the market.

Read full article →

item.title: ASIC's Stamp Duty Review Could Boost Property Investment
item.description:
Source: Real Commercial

ASIC's review of superannuation stamp duty reporting may unleash $10 billion for property investment, potentially delivering 35,000 new homes in five years. This move could significantly impact the property market and housing supply.

Read full article →
item.content:encoded:
Source: Real Commercial

ASIC's review of superannuation stamp duty reporting may unleash $10 billion for property investment, potentially delivering 35,000 new homes in five years. This move could significantly impact the property market and housing supply.

Read full article →

item.title: Two North Sydney Offices Change Hands
item.description:
Source: RE Source

Indara Infrastructure has sold two prominent offices in North Sydney, including the significant 205 Pacific Highway in St Leonards. The deal highlights ongoing interest in the North Sydney commercial property market.

Read full article →
item.content:encoded:
Source: RE Source

Indara Infrastructure has sold two prominent offices in North Sydney, including the significant 205 Pacific Highway in St Leonards. The deal highlights ongoing interest in the North Sydney commercial property market.

Read full article →

item.title: Gateway Capital Acquires $75m Eastern Creek Facility
item.description:
Source: Real Commercial

Gateway Capital has capitalised on market conditions to purchase a prime $75 million logistics facility in Sydney's Eastern Creek. This acquisition is part of their strategy to seed an $800 million fund, even as major property players face redemption challenges.

Read full article →
item.content:encoded:
Source: Real Commercial

Gateway Capital has capitalised on market conditions to purchase a prime $75 million logistics facility in Sydney's Eastern Creek. This acquisition is part of their strategy to seed an $800 million fund, even as major property players face redemption challenges.

Read full article →

item.title: Elanor Investors Hits Back at Lederer
item.description:
Source: Real Commercial

Elanor Investors Group has countered billionaire Paul Lederer's attempts to seize control of its $276 million listed office fund. The ongoing battle highlights the competitive landscape in the property funds sector.

Read full article →
item.content:encoded:
Source: Real Commercial

Elanor Investors Group has countered billionaire Paul Lederer's attempts to seize control of its $276 million listed office fund. The ongoing battle highlights the competitive landscape in the property funds sector.

Read full article →

item.title: Dexus offloads Flinders Gate for $260m
item.description:
Source: Real Commercial

Dexus has sold its prime Melbourne office complex, Flinders Gate, to Asian investor PAG for $260 million. This move is part of Dexus's strategy to reduce debt and concentrate on higher-returning assets.

Read full article →
item.content:encoded:
Source: Real Commercial

Dexus has sold its prime Melbourne office complex, Flinders Gate, to Asian investor PAG for $260 million. This move is part of Dexus's strategy to reduce debt and concentrate on higher-returning assets.

Read full article →

item.title: Rezoning Push for 742ha SEQ Rural Land
item.description:
Source: The Urban Developer

A coalition of landowners is advocating for the rezoning of 742 hectares of rural land in South East Queensland, aiming to transform it for housing and infrastructure development west of the Gold Coast. This move could significantly impact local property markets and development opportunities in the region.

Read full article →
item.content:encoded:
Source: The Urban Developer

A coalition of landowners is advocating for the rezoning of 742 hectares of rural land in South East Queensland, aiming to transform it for housing and infrastructure development west of the Gold Coast. This move could significantly impact local property markets and development opportunities in the region.

Read full article →

item.title: Mapletree sells key Woolworths distribution centre
item.description:
Source: RE Source

Mapletree Logistics Trust has divested a vital regional distribution centre in Wodonga, Victoria, which services 75% of the population within 24 hours. This asset was crucial for Woolworths' operations, highlighting its significance in the logistics landscape.

Read full article →

Source: RE Source
